title: Graduate Assistant - Research Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette
Interview Descriptions: What are your jobs and responsibilities? What are your weakness and strength? How can you be a team player? If given the opportunity for a task, can you handle it well under pressure
Interview Questions: How can you contribute? Can you handle pressure?

title: Inspector Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette
Interview Descriptions: Process was welcoming. Felt comfortable and was able to connect with the personal. The overall experience was positive to say the least. If going for interview make sure you are prepared.
Interview Questions: What skills do you bring to the company?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette
Interview Descriptions: It was a good process until no communication was shared after the final round of interviews. Job is still not filled at this time. If you have to travel, you have to pay for your own travel upfront.
Interview Questions: How you work on a team.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette
Interview Descriptions: Interview in front of panel of department heads.  They took turns asking questions and were relatively nice. Whole interview took maybe 40 minutes.  I had experience in the department so we didn't do introductions.
Interview Questions: What would you change about the current way the department is run?

title: Student IT Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette (Lafayette, LA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Assisting departments with hardware installations,  updates, and maintenance for classrooms as well as computer labs. Digital signage programs for departments throughout campus as well as off main campus locations. Database administration.
Interview Questions: Abilities to work on computers, comfortable with software,

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette (Lafayette, LA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was good, they were on time, two people interview me, basically explain about the position and asked for my background,  it was a coordination job and all was I ask if I was going to be comfortable with coordination with customers and other departments   and other few questions and got hired
Interview Questions: Explained to me about the work

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette (Lafayette, LA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: there was no interview I just me with the people working there. We talked, I went to some classes, we had lunch and they offered me the job and I took it.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Quick and Easy, not at all challenging. They really only care about your availability. You do have to work at least 1 night. You simply need to go to the Dean of the libraries office and fill out a form. You also need to make sure you qualify for work study, otherwise you can't work at the library.
Interview Questions: What days are you available?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette (Lafayette, LA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The professor had asked me a few questions on my previous work experience and asked my to explain about my projects. I started to tell him where I did my undergraduate and schooling and then explained about my projects. I had also done an android project which I described it to him.
Interview Questions: Did I have any mobile programming experience and what was that?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette (Lafayette, LA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: it was via the internet....asked me why i wanted to study physics.......i told them i was in love with physics......a panel of 3 women interviewed me........it took about 30 minutes........ i then got the offer after 4 days.  they were very nice and friendly
Interview Questions: asked me why i wanted to study physics.i told them i was in love with physics......a panel of 3 women interviewed me........it took about 30 minutes........ it took 4 days to get the offer.they were very nice and friendly

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette (Lafayette, LA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initially, you need to submit your resume to CACS advisor. After studying your resume, he will set up an interview based on the course work and your grades you have achieved in the previous semesters.
Interview Questions: Which programming languages are you comfortable?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette (Lafayette, LA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Great, friendly. I explained my previous experiences and how it relates to the job description. I got an interview in days. They were friendly and warm. I encourage people to come prepared with fit answers to questions such as why should we hire you? Tell me when you worked in a team and your contribution? How would you handle a team mate that is not following guild-lines?
Interview Questions: Are you computer savvy?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was one on one interview with department head? After about a week I received email asking me to submit my personal information to the secretary for processing of the final appointment offer. A month later, I was given my assigned class and all the necessary decument
Interview Questions: How will you manage over 100 students on weekly basis

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette (Lafayette, LA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone. He asked me about my research interests and job experience. Offered me the job in an email later, He happened to be the smartest and coolest professor I ever worked with. He was nice and understanding. Tried to help me get a higher pay but university wasn't cooperating.
Interview Questions: Pretty much discussed previous work.

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was very simple. Not very many questions were asked. If a person is willing to learn as they go they will do fine at this job.  I was actually hired on the spot. I began the job the next day after the interview.
Interview Questions: What are your goals here?

title: Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette (Lafayette, LA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very pleasant. I was asked some general interview questions, and answered accordingly. After all was said and done I got the job. Unfortunately, funding was cut, and so was I, the following year.
Interview Questions: What made you want this job?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette
Interview Descriptions: Hiring based on being able to fine a position.  Does not have to be within your field of study, but can be helpful if it is.  Much of the interview depends on the area you will be working in.  Definitely a plus if you were/are involved on campus.  Good grades are a must
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Student Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette (Lafayette, LA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application and they looked at called me in and asked me when I could start.  There was really no interview they just asked me if I knew my alphabet and could file.
Interview Questions: They really just asked when I could start and how much I could work.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview is technical. I answered well. I answered almost all the questions which i was asked on my resume. They will test your spontaneousness, technical and soft skills, presentation skills. Hired me . It went cool, Interviewers are very friendly. Arranged lunch after done with interview process. Nothing more to say about it. Such a good experience.
Interview Questions: General Technical ques on c/c++/java and on your job exp.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette (Lafayette, LA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Easy to apply, but it can take a while for your file to be found in the stack of applications that are received from students interested in a campus job. You literally never know who will call you with a position available, UNLESS you're connected with someone working in a department who'll hire you directly. Most departments and offices have no real expectations of the "employees" they hire, since a fair amount of student aides haven't had real jobs before.
Interview Questions: They typically ask simple things like "What's your class schedule?" "When can you work?"

title: Student Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette (Lafayette, LA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: You meet with one of the managers and discuss your past work experience. Stress customer service and being versatile with technology. Bring a printed resume so they can see what technology you have configured or set up/maintain. Iphones, roku, computers/printers/wifi.
Interview Questions: What kind of devices have you used?

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Louisiana at Lafayette (Lafayette, LA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: formal
Interview Questions: how you overcame diversity
